title: Immunity Boosting Foods: Cow Ghee - Natural Immunity Booster
description: Immunity Boosting Foods: Pure cow ghee as natural immunity booster and how to make it at home
cleaned_text: your diet In every day's hustle and bustle, we forget to focus on what we are eating and how that affects our health. A person is healthy if they have a strong immunity system. The generations before us have diligently taken care of themselves by adding small things like a warm glass of milk, jaggery, herbs and spices to their everyday diet. Cow ghee is one of these foods that is known to boost immunity and in times of the global pandemic that we are facing, stronger immunity is the need of the hour. [readmore](javascript://) 02/5Ghee as an Ayurvedic medicine Increased pollution, stress level, along with never-seen-before flu and viruses emerging in the environment, improving our immunity has become very important. Ayurveda says that one should eat ghee in the morning on an empty stomach that improves the process of cell rejuvenation which boosts the healing process of our body. Ghee is comprised of medium and long-chain fatty acids. It is rich in omega-3 and omega-9 fatty acids along with vitamins A, D, E and K. Ghee helps in improving digestion, increases your memory and intellect, improves skin and eye health, along with that, acts as a lubricant for joints. It is a good source of Butyrate fatty acid which is essential for preventing many digestive system diseases. [readmore](javascript://) 03/5What is Butyric acid? Butyric acid is found in cow ghee. It is vital for the intestinal walls, reducing the chances of inflammation. A Japanese study shows that butyric acid is good for boosting immunity. Butyric acid is a short-chain fatty acid that is created when the good bacteria in your gut breaks down the dietary fibre. Its primary health benefit is that it provides energy to colon cells. Among other digestive system diseases, ghee helps in reducing the risk of colon cancer. The benefit of butyric acid is that it can prevent and treat colorectal cancer, i.e. colon cancer. [readmore](javascript://) 04/5Cow ghee for boosting immunity Ghee is a rich source of butyrate. It is great for improving immunity and keeping the digestive system healthy. A healthy gut and strong immunity are essential to stay fit. To gain the benefits of ghee for stronger immunity, one should consume 100% verified Cow ghee made with traditional Bilona process. This traditional process includes converting whole milk into curds and churning it with a bilona to make the butter which is later heated to make ghee. [readmore](javascript://) 05/5How to make ghee at home? Instead of buying processed ghee, make ghee at home which is rich in essential nutrients and will provide you with a healthy lifestyle: To make ghee, collect milk cream/malai in a bowl and freeze. When you have enough malai, take it out of the freezer and allow it to come down at room temperature. Then, add curd to it and let it set overnight. The next day, add the malai to a food processor and add a cup of cold water to it. Whisk the mixture until the butter separates from the milk and collects together. Wash the butter with ice-cold water. When the water becomes clean, stop washing the butter. This is done to wash away milk solids. Then, as we always do, heat the butter in a kadhai on low flame until ghee starts floating on top. Strain the ghee and store in a jar.
